hook.text: Hacks drain billions from DeFi yearly. Insurance protocols now let users buy cover against smart contract failures.

buildup.text: Nexus Mutual and InsurAce let users pay premiums to protect their DeFi deposits against exploits.

discovery.text: Claims are assessed by token holder votes, not insurance adjusters. The community decides what gets paid.

twist.text: Coverage is expensive and limited. Most DeFi users don't bother with insurance â€” until they get exploited.

climax.text: DeFi insurance is growing but still covers a tiny fraction of total deposits. The gap between risk and coverage is enormous.

punchline.text: DeFi has insurance now. Almost nobody buys it.

quiz.question: How are DeFi insurance claims typically assessed?
options: By token holder votes in the protocol community
